discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Ransome is a kind of attache that encrypts your data or OS and require payment in a give time

Selected Answer: C
The crypto-malware class of ransomware attempts to encrypt data files on any 
fixed, removable, and network drives. If the attack is successful, the user will be 
unable to access the files without obtaining the private encryption key, which is held 
by the attacker. If successful, this sort of attack is extremely difficult to mitigate, 
unless the user has up to date backups of the encrypted files.

Selected Answer: C
C - correct
The attack that encrypts user data and requires a proper backup implementation to recover is ransomware. Therefore, the correct answer is C.

questions.question_text: Which of the following attacks encrypts user data and requires a proper backup implementation to recover?

Client devices cannot enter a network, and the network administrator determines the DHCP scope is exhausted. The administrator wants to avoid creating a new
DHCP pool. Which of the following can the administrator perform to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D, Reducing the lease time is the best answer here. While there isn't much additional info regarding how long it currently is, if some jabroni configured a lease time of two weeks, there will be a bunch of lingering leases that aren't in use and could be utilized by new devices.

So a b and c do not make sense. Given they do not want to increase the scope of the DHCP, even after it's exhausted. It's clear that they're looking for the fastest, and probably cheapest workaround solution to take care of this problem.

A. I don't see any need for load balancers
B. Installing more switches isn't going to do anything in this case. This is a dhcp scope issue, and installing switches isn't going to change the scope of the DHCP. 
C. Decreasing the number of vlans doesn't make sense.
D. Decreasing the lease time will allow other devices to connect. Some_specialist says it best with his/her example

Selected Answer: D
Diminuir o tempo de locação de endereços é a opção mais recomendada (D), isso porque em nossa rede poderemos ter dispositivos não permanentes dentro da rede, se este tiver um tempo de locação/conceção muito elevado, de uma ou duas semanas por exemplo, significa que tal endereço IP não será atribuído a outros dispositivos durante o periodo de locação, resultando assim em desperdício (nos casos de dispositivos) que não estarão em nossa rede nesse período, portanto, reduzir o tempo de locação para 2 ou 3 dias se torna a opção mais sensata, uma vez que os dispositivos dentro da rede terão a opção de renovar tais endereços ao fim dos tempo estabelecido, desde que estes continuem activos na rede...

Selected Answer: D
best option available and makes sense

Selected Answer: D
To resolve the issue of DHCP scope exhaustion without creating a new DHCP pool, the administrator can take the following action:

D. Reduce the lease time: By reducing the lease time, DHCP addresses will be reclaimed more quickly when devices disconnect or renew their leases, allowing for more efficient use of the existing DHCP scope. This can help alleviate the exhaustion issue without the need for additional resources like load balancers, switches, or VLAN modifications.

Selected Answer: D
D. Reduce the lease time.

Selected Answer: D
Reduce the lease time

Selected Answer: A
Honeypot is a kind trap for attackers made available so that you can study the attack patterns.

Selected Answer: A
A honeypot can be a decoy, or a general line of defense of a company's network that still allows attackers in to be analyzed.
An antivirus would be trying to eliminate the person, or problem on the network altogether.
A screened subnet is meant to interface with most of the general public, or Internet for data trade of their own.

A honeypot can be a decoy, or a general line of defense of a company's network that still allows attackers in to be analyzed.
An antivirus would be trying to eliminate the person, or problem on the network altogether.
A screened subnet is meant to interface with most of the general public, or Internet for data trade of their own.

Selected Answer: A
A - correct

A. A honeypot is a decoy system designed to lure attackers into interacting with it and reveal their attack methods, tools, and objectives. By monitoring the honeypot's activity logs, network administrators can learn about new and existing threats and adjust their defenses accordingly. Therefore, implementing a honeypot can assist in analyzing attacks directed towards the company's network.

questions.question_text: A network administrator wants to analyze attacks directed toward the company's network. Which of the following must the network administrator implement to assist in this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
netstat is associated with listening to ports. Try it on your PC in the CLI or linux.

Selected Answer: B
The network statistics ( netstat ) command is a networking tool used for troubleshooting and configuration, that can also serve as a monitoring tool for connections over the network. Both incoming and outgoing connections, routing tables, port listening, and usage statistics are common uses for this command.

Selected Answer: B
B - correct
The correct command to check if the database engine is listening on a certain port is "netstat -a". Therefore, the answer is B.

Selected Answer: B
Netstat is the only given tool capable of port listening.

questions.question_text: A network administrator is configuring a database server and would like to ensure the database engine is listening on a certain port. Which of the following commands should the administrator use to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Wireless Client Isolation is a security feature that prevents wireless clients from communicating with one another. This feature is useful for guest and BYOD SSIDs adding a level of security to limit attacks and threats between devices connected to the wireless networks.

Selected Answer: A
Wireless client isolation—Clients connected to a WLAN are normally within 
the same broadcast domain and can communicate with one another. An access 
point can be configured to prevent this so that stations can only communicate 
via its gateway. Peer-to-peer traffic is dropped by the AP

Selected Answer: A
Wireless Client Isolation, often referred to as Client Isolation or Wireless Isolation, is a network feature that can be implemented on a wireless access point or router to restrict communication between wireless clients connected to the same wireless network. When client isolation is enabled, wireless devices connected to the same Wi-Fi network are prevented from communicating with each other, which can enhance network security and privacy.

Selected Answer: A
A - correct

Selected Answer: A
A. Wireless client isolation would be the best option to disallow associated stations from communicating with each other on a wireless network serving guests. It prevents clients from communicating directly with each other over the wireless network.

Selected Answer: A
Wireless client isolation prevents wireless stations within an SSID from communicating
directly with one another or with any devices on the wired network to which the wireless
network might be connected.

Selected Answer: A
Answer is Wireless Client Isolation. Wireless Client Isolation is a security feature that prevents wireless clients from communicating with one another. This feature is useful for guest and BYOD SSIDs adding a level of security to limit attacks and threats between devices connected to the wireless.

questions.question_text: A technician is implementing a new wireless network to serve guests at a local office. The network needs to provide Internet access but disallow associated stations from communicating with each other. Which of the following would BEST accomplish this requirement?
